channel.title: BBC News - Africa
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Tunisia President Kais Saied accused of coup amid clashes
item.description: Months of tensions over Covid and the economy culminates in the sacking of the prime minister.

item.title: AKO Caine Prize: Meron Hadero named first Ethiopian winner
item.description: Judges praised Meron Hadero's short story The Street Sweep which ends in a "clever twist".

item.title: Nigerian outrage at brazen bandit attacks
item.description: The shooting down of a military jet shows how organised crime is becoming more daring by the day.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Ruth Gbagbi, Hedaya Wahba and Seif Eissa all win taekwondo bronze
item.description: Ivory Coast's Ruth Gbagbi as well as Egyptian duo Hedaya Wahba and Seif Eissa win bronze in taekwondo on day three at the Tokyo Olympics.

item.title: Mali insurgency: Investigating corruption allegations in the military
item.description: Africa Eye investigates the cycle of death, violence and corruption in Mali's military.

item.title: Afrobeats in Japan: British-Nigerian hip hop dancer teaching children how to dance
item.description: Yinka Oshiletu, a British-Nigerian hip hop dancer is bringing Afrobeats sounds to Japan's young dancers.

item.title: Nigeria's hipster herders - the funky Fulanis
item.description: Fulani herders are usually found in forests herding cattle but when they go to cities, they dress in style.

item.title: Sunday Igboho: The Nigerian separatist who wants a Yoruba nation
item.description: Sunday Igboho is accused of stoking ethnic tensions in Nigeria after targeting Fulani herders.

item.title: Ethiopia's Tigray crisis: What's stopping aid getting in?
item.description: A renewed surge in fighting has made it ever more difficult for aid to reach areas in desperate need.

item.title: Ethiopia Tigray crisis: New front opens as aid fears grow
item.description: A bloody eight-month battle for control of the Tigray region spills over into neighbouring Afar.

item.title: Benin Bronzes: Nigeria dispute jeopardises return of artefacts
item.description: Several museums in Europe have talked of returning the looted artefacts - but where will they be housed in Nigeria?

item.title: Sudan's Darfur conflict's latest surge in violence displaces thousands
item.description: "I have cried so much, my eyes can barely see," one mother tells the BBC after seeing her brother die.

item.title: Nigeria's security crises - five different threats
item.description: Almost every part of Nigeria is facing a security crisis - from kidnapping to extremist insurgencies.

item.title: DRC volcano: Reuniting children with families after the eruption
item.description: Children are still separated from parents, two months after a volcano erupted near Goma in DR Congo.

item.title: Halima Aden and Tommy Hilfiger: ‘It’s not just about diverse catwalks’
item.description: The world’s first hijab-wearing supermodel talks to fashion designer Tommy Hilfiger about why she quit the industry.

item.title: Teenage skateboarder Boipelo Awuah is the youngest African at Tokyo 2020
item.description: Fifteen-year-old skateboarder Boipelo Awuah is the youngest African at Tokyo 2020. She explains how she got into the sport and why it feels so good to be at the Olympics.

item.title: Tanzania: Erick Kabendera on Samia Suluhu Hassan, being imprisoned and freedom
item.description: Freed Tanzanian journalist Erick Kabendera says the country needs to tackle injustices which took place during John Magufuli's presidency.

item.title: Joshi is swapping life in captivity for a new start in the jungle
item.description: After a lifetime in captivity, Joshi is going to live in the jungle in Congo-Brazzaville.

item.title: Tokyo 2020 Olympics: Kenya's Taekwondo star and environmental activist
item.description: Kenya's Taekwondo star Faith Ogallo hopes to win a medal in Tokyo - to raise environmental awareness.

item.title: South Africa riots: The community standing up to looters
item.description: The government has said it will deploy 25,000 troops, but some residents are already taking action.
